intro: Fumaria grandiflora, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy coating. Fumaria grandiflora is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
